page.title: 10THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: Wichenford has a thriving{Women's {Institute}with 32 members of all ages. They meet monthly on a{Tuesday}at 7.30 A{raffle}for charity, or{competition is usually held; six biscuits, single rose, decorated egg, holiday snap. Members are rostered to provide {coffee, flowers}or be{hosess}at the meetings, and a{guest speaker}talks to the group after the general business. This year's addresses have induded: {homeopathy, cancer, corn dollies {Marks and Spencers, Canada}and {Nigeria,}as well as a{garden meeting and{birthday party. {Subscriptions}of{Â£3.75}per year cover meeting costs, and they also hold stalls, raffles and other activities. Only the{president}wears a badge of office. She is elected for{3 years}and also heads the committee which meets to set the agenda for full meetings.
